column10: People on Gibbon St are always blocking the intersection at Alfred St, so traffic on Alfred St can't cross Gibbons St. It creates a big back up. They're just bring selfish and not wanting to wait and not block the intersection!
This happens daily. Pedestrians constantly yell at drivers to slow down or stop here to which they consistently blow through the stop sign.
One car turning left onto Route 1 claims not to have seen us, and actually ran into us. He came to a stop wedged against my sons stroller. Somehow no one was hurt .
Car speeding northbound on Route 1 ran red light and nearly hit me as I was walking in the crosswalk.

I was at the intersection of Wilkes and S. Patrick street, when a driver came barreling through a red light and almost t-boned my car. It would have been fatal had I not reacted in time because of the rate of speed at which the driver was going.

Northbound driver on Hwy 1 blew through the red stop light after the pedestrian crossing had illuminated and would have crashed into me and my child on our ebike if I had not swerved to avoid it. Running the red light is frequent here, especially at night, and is a major hazard at this intersection where there are often families with kids going to and from schools in Old Town. It is the only viable crossing of Route 1 in this part of the City.
column21: The city should reduce the lanes of Hwy 1 through Alexandria, turning the saved space into greenery and protected bike lanes. That would slow drivers and reduce congestion by making it safe to use for purposes other than driving.
